input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 61 for accounting firm use.
  - Designate Floor 80 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 36 for office use.
  - Designate Floor 19 for library use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 61 to 67 for a comprehensive library with study areas and archives.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

checks_range.61: comprehensive library with study areas and archives
checks_range.62: comprehensive library with study areas and archives
checks_range.63: comprehensive library with study areas and archives
checks_range.64: comprehensive library with study areas and archives
checks_range.65: comprehensive library with study areas and archives
checks_range.66: comprehensive library with study areas and archives
checks_range.67: comprehensive library with study areas and archives

Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.3: Midsummer Night's Feast featuring Grilled Salmon
checks_once.19: Winter Solstice Feast featuring Venison Stew
checks_once.4: Australia Day BBQ featuring Lamb Chops
checks_once.13: April Fool's Surprise Menu featuring Mystery Dish
checks_once.38: Restaurant's 10th Anniversary featuring Champagne and Caviar

checks_range.26: Game Meat Fortnight featuring Venison Steaks
checks_range.27: Game Meat Fortnight featuring Venison Steaks

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week, we explore the essence of winter with hearty and comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare: Fresh salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
1.2) Truffle Frites: Crispy fries tossed in truffle oil and sprinkled with parmesan. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Wellington: Thinly sliced beef fillet wrapped in puff pastry with a rich mushroom duxelles. 
2.2) Braised Short Ribs: Slow-cooked short ribs with a savory reduction sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until caramelized and seasoned with thyme. 
3.2) Creamed Spinach: Spinach sautéed in butter and cream, garnished with toasted pine nuts. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Apple Crumble: Warm apple crumble with a crunchy oat topping. 
4.2) Panna Cotta: Silky vanilla panna cotta with a raspberry coulis. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A range of robust red wines to pair with the main courses. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: Rich hot chocolate with a sprinkle of cinnamon.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
Celebrate Midsummer Night's Feast with our special grilled salmon. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Octopus: Tentacles marinated in olive oil, lemon, and garlic, then grilled to perfection. 
1.2) Artichoke Hearts: Marinated artichoke hearts served with a tangy vinaigrette. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillets grilled over charcoal, served with a dill sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Scallops: Succulent scallops seared to a golden brown, served with a white wine reduction. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted with olive oil and sea salt. 
3.2) Wild Rice Pilaf: A flavorful pilaf made with wild rice, mushrooms, and onions. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Sorbet: Refreshing lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
4.2) Raspberry Tart: A light and flaky tart filled with fresh raspberries. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A variety of crisp white wines to complement the seafood. 
5.2) Sparkling Water: Freshly chilled sparkling water with a slice of lemon.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week, we focus on the warmth of winter with a hearty venison stew. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Smoked Gouda Canapés: Miniature sandwiches filled with smoked gouda and chives. 
1.2) Roasted Beet Salad: Beets roasted until tender, dressed with balsamic glaze and goat cheese. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Venison Stew: Slow-cooked venison with root vegetables and a red wine reduction. 
2.2) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb: Lamb chops coated in a herbed crust and roasted to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes with a hint of rosemary. 
3.2) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted with thyme and garlic. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Fondue: Warm chocolate fondue with a variety of dipping fruits. 
4.2) Pear and Walnut Cake: A moist cake with chunks of pear and walnuts. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A selection of full-bodied red wines to pair with the venison. 
5.2) Hot Mulled Wine: Spiced mulled wine to warm up the evening.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
Enjoy a delightful array of international flavors this week. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Moroccan Spiced Chicken Skewers: Chicken marinated in a blend of spices and grilled. 
1.2) Thai Green Curry Soup: A spicy green curry soup with coconut milk and vegetables. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Tandoori Chicken: Chicken marinated in yogurt and spices, grilled to perfection. 
2.2) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef in red wine with mushrooms and onions. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Basmati Rice: Fragrant basmati rice with a hint of cardamom. 
3.2) Roasted Cauliflower: Cauliflower roasted with olive oil and lemon zest. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing mango lassi with a touch of cardamom. 
4.2) Baklava: Layers of phyllo dough filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A range of red wines to complement the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Assorted Teas: A selection of aromatic teas to enjoy with your meal.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
This week, we highlight the versatility of seafood with a variety of options. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a zesty cocktail sauce. 
1.2) Oyster Rockefeller: Oysters topped with spinach, herbs, and a creamy sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Seafood Paella: A vibrant paella with a mix of shrimp, mussels, and chorizo. 
2.2) Grilled Swordfish: Swordfish fillets grilled to perfection, served with a lemon-butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mussels: Mussels steamed with garlic and white wine. 
3.2) Roasted Bell Peppers: Bell peppers roasted until tender and stuffed with quinoa and feta. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Coconut Sorbet: A light and refreshing coconut sorbet. 
4.2) Chocolate Truffle Cake: A rich chocolate cake with truffle-flavored ganache. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A range of white wines to pair with the seafood. 
5.2) Sparkling Water: Freshly chilled sparkling water with a slice of cucumber.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
Experience the flavors of the Mediterranean this week. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Greek Salad: A classic salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese. 
1.2) Hummus Platter: A platter of hummus, baba ganoush, and tabbouleh. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Lamb Chops: Tender lamb chops grilled to perfection, served with a mint yogurt sauce. 
2.2) Ratatouille: A vegetable stew made with eggplant, zucchini, and bell peppers. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with rosemary and garlic. 
3.2) Grilled Zucchini: Zucchini grilled until tender and seasoned with olive oil and lemon. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: Layers of phyllo dough filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup. 
4.2) Turkish Delight: A traditional Turkish confection made with rosewater and sugar. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A range of red wines to complement the Mediterranean flavors. 
5.2) Assorted Teas: A selection of aromatic teas to enjoy with your meal.

 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th): 
This week, we celebrate the flavors of Asia with a fusion of Eastern and Western cuisines. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Sushi Rolls: A selection of sushi rolls with various fillings. 
1.2) Spring Rolls: Crispy spring rolls filled with vegetables and shrimp. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Kung Pao Chicken: Chicken stir-fried with peanuts, chili peppers, and vegetables. 
2.2) Beef Teriyaki: Grilled beef marinated in teriyaki sauce, served with steamed rice. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Bok Choy: Bok choy steamed with garlic and soy sauce. 
3.2) Fried Rice: A hearty bowl of fried rice with vegetables and eggs. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Green Tea Ice Cream: A light and refreshing ice cream made with green tea. 
4.2) Mango Sticky Rice: A sweet dessert made with sticky rice and fresh mango. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Asian-Inspired Cocktails: A selection of cocktails inspired by Asian flavors. 
5.2) Assorted Teas: A selection of aromatic teas to enjoy with your meal.

 Menu Week 9 (February 26th - March 4th): 
This week, we focus on the freshness of spring with a variety of seasonal ingredients. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Vegetable Tart: A tart filled with a mix of spring vegetables and herbs. 
1.2) Avocado Deviled Eggs: Deviled eggs filled with a creamy avocado mixture. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Chicken Thighs: Chicken thighs grilled to perfection, served with a lemon herb sauce. 
2.2) Mushroom Risotto: A creamy risotto made with a variety of mushrooms. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted with olive oil and sea salt. 
3.2) Grilled Corn on the Cob: Corn on the cob grilled until tender and seasoned with butter. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Strawberry Shortcake: A light and fluffy shortcake with fresh strawberries. 
4.2) Lemon Bars: A classic dessert with a buttery crust and a tangy filling. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A range of white wines to pair with the spring flavors. 
5.2) Sparkling Water: Freshly chilled sparkling water with a slice of lemon.

 Menu Week 10 (March 5th - March 11th): 
This week, we explore the rich flavors of Italy with a variety of pasta dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with diced tomatoes, basil, and garlic. 
1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil drizzled with olive oil. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Carbonara: A classic pasta dish with eggs, pancetta, and Parmesan cheese. 
2.2) Lasagna: Layers of pasta, meat sauce, and ricotta cheese baked to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Grilled Artichokes: Artichokes grilled until tender and seasoned with olive oil and lemon. 
3.2) Roasted Garlic Bread: Garlic bread roasted until crispy and golden. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Tiramisu: A classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
4.2) Cannoli: Crispy shells filled with sweet ricotta and chocolate chips. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A range of red wines to complement the pasta dishes. 
5.2) Assorted Teas: A selection of aromatic teas to enjoy with your meal.

 Menu Week 11 (March 12th - March 18th): 
This week, we celebrate the flavors of the Caribbean with a variety of tropical dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Jerk Chicken Wings: Chicken wings marinated in jerk seasoning and grilled. 
1.2) Plantain Chips: Thinly sliced plantains fried until crispy. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Jamaican Jerk Chicken: Chicken marinated in jerk seasoning and grilled to perfection. 
2.2) Coconut Shrimp: Shrimp battered and fried, served with a sweet and sour sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Rice and Peas: A flavorful dish made with rice, peas, and coconut milk. 
3.2) Grilled Pineapple: Pineapple grilled until caramelized and seasoned with brown sugar.

4.1) Rum Cake: A rich and moist cake soaked in rum. 
4.2) Coconut Sorbet: A light and refreshing coconut sorbet. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Rum Punch: A refreshing rum punch with a variety of tropical fruits. 
5.2) Assorted Teas: A selection of aromatic teas to enjoy with your meal.

 Menu Week 12 (March 19th - March 25th): 
Burger Mondays begin this week! 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Truffle Fries: Crispy fries tossed in truffle oil and sprinkled with parmesan. 
1.2) Grilled Halloumi: Grilled halloumi cheese with a drizzle of honey. 
2 Main Courses: 
2.1) Gourmet Burger: A juicy beef p patty topped with bacon, avocado, and a fried egg. 
2.2) Veggie Burger: A hearty veggie burger with roasted vegetables and a tahini sauce.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 02-02 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-11 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.5 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 32 to Week 35 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week’s menu is a blend of traditional and modern flavors, perfect for a cozy evening. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare: Fresh salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
1.2) Artichoke Hearts: Marinated artichoke hearts served with a drizzle of olive oil and balsamic reduction. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Wellington: Thinly sliced beef fillet wrapped in puff pastry, baked to golden perfection. 
2.2) Chicken Marsala: Chicken breasts sautéed in a rich marsala wine sauce with mushrooms. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted with garlic and thyme. 
3.2) Creamed Spinach: Spinach sautéed with garlic and cream, seasoned with nutmeg. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Raspberry Sorbet: Refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
4.2) Panna Cotta: Silky vanilla panna cotta with a hint of almond. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A variety of red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Sparkling Water: For those who prefer a non-alcoholic option.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
A week dedicated to fresh and vibrant flavors, ideal for a winter evening. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves, grilled to perfection. 
1.2) Grilled Asparagus: Asparagus spears marinated in olive oil and lemon zest, grilled until tender. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pan-Seared Cod: Cod fillets seared to a golden crust, served with a light lemon butter sauce. 
2.2) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef stewed in red wine with onions, carrots, and mushrooms. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted with rosemary and thyme. 
3.2) Garlic Butter Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes infused with garlic and butter. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tart with a flaky crust and a zesty lemon filling. 
4.2) Chocolate Truffle Cake: Rich chocolate cake with truffle-infused ganache. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A range of white wines to complement the lighter main courses. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, velvety hot chocolate to finish the meal.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week’s menu features a mix of comforting and exotic flavors, perfect for a winter night. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Thai Green Curry Soup: A spicy green curry soup with coconut milk, chicken, and vegetables. 
1.2) Smoked Paprika Bruschetta: Toasted baguette slices topped with a mixture of tomatoes, red onion, and smoked paprika. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Slow-cooked short ribs with a savory red wine sauce. 
2.2) Grilled Lamb Chops: Lamb chops marinated in herbs and spices, grilled to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes roasted with olive oil and rosemary. 
3.2) Garlic and Herb Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes with a blend of garlic and herbs. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mango Sorbet: A refreshing mango sorbet to cool down the palate. 
4.2) Apple Crumble: Warm apple crumble with a crunchy oat topping. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A selection of robust red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Hot Spiced Wine: A warming spiced wine to enjoy during the cold evenings.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
A week of international flavors, celebrating the diversity of global cuisine. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Moroccan Couscous Salad: A colorful salad with couscous, chickpeas, olives, and preserved lemons. 
1.2) Spanish Tapas: A selection of small plates including patatas bravas, jamón ibérico, and marinated olives. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Indian Butter Chicken: Chicken cooked in a creamy tomato-based sauce with garam masala. 
2.2) Japanese Sushi Platter: A variety of sushi rolls and sashimi, accompanied by wasabi and soy sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Cauliflower: Cauliflower roasted with turmeric and cumin. 
3.2) Steamed Rice: Fluffy steamed rice to accompany the main courses. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mango Lassi: A sweet and tangy yogurt drink with mango puree. 
4.2) Matcha Green Tea Cake: A delicate green tea cake with a matcha filling. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Indian Masala Chai: A spiced tea to complement the Indian flavors. 
5.2) Japanese Green Tea: A refreshing green tea to enjoy with the sushi platter.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
This week’s menu focuses on fresh and light flavors, perfect for a mid-winter break. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Avocado Deviled Eggs: Deviled eggs filled with a creamy avocado mixture. 
1.2) Grilled Vegetable Skewers: A mix of zucchini, bell peppers, and onions, grilled to perfection. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Salmon with Dill Sauce: Salmon fillets grilled to perfection, served with a tangy dill sauce. 
2.2) Chicken Satay: Chicken skewers marinated in lemongrass and served with peanut sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Carrots: Carrots roasted with honey and cinnamon. 
3.2) Quinoa Pilaf: A flavorful quinoa pilaf with sautéed onions and garlic. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Raspberry Cheesecake: A light cheesecake with a raspberry coulis. 
4.2) Coconut Rice Pudding: A creamy rice pudding flavored with coconut milk. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A range of white wines to pair with the lighter main courses. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing iced tea to enjoy during the warmer days.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
A week of hearty and comforting dishes, perfect for a cozy evening. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Halloumi Cheese: Halloumi cheese grilled until crispy, served with a side of tzatziki. 
1.2) Grilled Octopus: Tentacles marinated in olive oil and lemon, grilled until tender. 
2. Main Courses:

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.

3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.

This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week, we explore the flavors of the Mediterranean with a focus on fresh seafood and robust vegetables. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Octopus: Tentacles marinated in olive oil, lemon, and herbs, grilled to perfection. 
1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, basil, and balsamic glaze. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Sea Bass with Lemon Butter Sauce: Flaky sea bass fillets poached in a light lemon butter sauce. 
2.2) Lamb Chops with Rosemary: Juicy lamb chops seasoned with rosemary and grilled to medium-rare. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts tossed with olive oil, salt, and pepper, roasted until crispy. 
3.2) Quinoa Pilaf: A fragrant pilaf made with quinoa, sautéed onions, and fresh herbs. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: Layers of phyllo dough filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup. 
4.2) Greek Yogurt with Honey and Walnuts: A refreshing yogurt topped with honey and toasted walnuts. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Rosé Wine: A crisp, dry rosé to pair with the Mediterranean flavors. 
5.2) Ouzo: An anise-flavored aperitif to start the meal.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
Our menu this week is inspired by the vibrant spices and bold flavors of India. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Samosas: Crispy pastry pockets filled with spiced potatoes and peas, deep-fried to golden perfection. 
1.2) Chicken Tikka: Marinated chicken cubes grilled to perfection and served with mint chutney. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Butter Chicken: Slow-cooked chicken in a creamy tomato-based sauce. 
2.2) Vegetable Korma: Vegetables simmered in a rich coconut milk and yogurt sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Naan Bread: Soft, pillowy flatbreads brushed with ghee. 
3.2) Rice Pilaf: A fragrant basmati rice pilaf with saffron and cardamom. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Gulab Jamun: Deep-fried milk balls soaked in sugar syrup. 
4.2) Kulfi: Traditional Indian ice cream in various flavors. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Masala Chai: Spiced tea with cardamom, cinnamon, and black pepper. 
5.2) Mango Lassi: Sweet yogurt drink with mango puree and a hint of cardamom.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week, we delve into the rich culinary traditions of France, focusing on classic French dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Escargots de Bourgogne: Snails cooked in garlic butter and parsley. 
1.2) Ratatouille Tart: A savory tart filled with ratatouille, a vegetable stew. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Coq au Vin: Chicken braised in red wine with mushrooms and onions. 
2.2) Beef Bourguignon: Beef stewed in red wine with carrots and pearl onions. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Creamed Spinach: Spinach sautéed in butter and cream. 
3.2) Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with garlic and thyme. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Crème Brûlée: Rich custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust. 
4.2) Tarte Tatin: Upside-down apple tart with caramelized sugar. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine: A selection of full-bodied red wines to complement the hearty dishes. 
5.2) Calvados: A traditional apple brandy to finish the meal.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
We celebrate the season with a variety of squash and pumpkin dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Butternut Squash Soup: Creamy soup made with roasted butternut squash and spices. 
1.2) Pumpkin Hummus: A unique twist on traditional hummus, made with roasted pumpkin. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pumpkin Risotto: Arborio rice cooked with pumpkin puree and Parmesan cheese. 
2.2) Squash Lasagna: Layers of zucchini noodles and pumpkin filling, topped with ricotta and mozzarella. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Acorn Squash: Squash roasted with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 
3.2) Sweet Potato Fries: Thinly sliced sweet potatoes fried until crispy. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Pumpkin Pie: Classic American pie with a flaky crust and spiced filling. 
4.2) Apple and Pumpkin Crisp: A warm, comforting dessert with a crumbly topping. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Apple Cider: Warm, spiced apple cider to enjoy on a chilly evening. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: Rich, velvety hot chocolate with whipped cream.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
This week, we explore the flavors of Italy, with a focus on pasta and seafood. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Arancini: Fried rice balls filled with ragù and mozzarella. 
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with diced tomatoes, basil, and garlic. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Spaghetti Carbonara: Classic spaghetti tossed with a creamy sauce made from eggs, Pecorino Romano, and guanciale. 
2.2) Seafood Linguine: Linguine pasta with a light tomato sauce and a mix of shrimp, clams, and mussels. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, basil, and balsamic glaze. 
3.2) Garlic Bread: Soft, buttery bread brushed with garlic and olive oil. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
4.2) Cannoli: Crispy shells filled with sweet ricotta and chocolate chips. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Chianti: A robust red wine from Tuscany. 
5.2) Prosecco: A sparkling wine to celebrate the Italian spirit.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
Our menu this week is inspired by the diverse flavors of Asia, with a focus on Japanese cuisine. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with salt.

2. Main Courses:

2.2) Teriyaki Chicken: Chicken marinated in teriyaki sauce and grilled to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes:

3.2) Rice: Short-grain sushi rice seasoned with vinegar. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Green Tea Ice Cream: A refreshing, creamy ice cream made with matcha powder. 
4.2) Mochi: Soft, chewy rice cakes filled with sweet bean paste. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Green Tea: A delicate, aromatic green tea to complement the flavors. 
5.2) Sake: A traditional Japanese rice wine to enhance the dining experience.

 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th): 
This week, we celebrate the flavors of the Caribbean with a focus on jerk and spicy dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Jerk Chicken Wings: Chicken wings marinated in jerk seasoning and grilled to perfection. 
1.2) Plantains: Fried plantains seasoned with salt and served as a side. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Jerk Pork: Pork shoulder slow-cooked with jerk seasoning and served with a side of rice and peas.

3.2) Rice and Peas: A flavorful combination of rice and pigeon peas. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Coconut Sorbet: A refreshing sorbet made with fresh coconut milk.

5. Drinks: 
5.1) Rum Punch: A tropical punch made with dark rum, pineapple juice, and lime. 
5.2) Ginger Beer: A spicy, refreshing non-alcoholic beverage.

 Menu Week 9 (February 26th - March 4th): 
Burger Mondays! This week, we serve our Gourmet Burgers every Monday. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Truffle Fries: Thick-cut fries drizzled with truffle oil and parmesan cheese. 
1.2) Mini Corn Dogs: Corn dogs served on a stick, perfect for sharing. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Gourmet Burger: A juicy beef patty topped with cheddar cheese, bacon, avocado, and a house-made aioli. 
2.2) Veggie Burger: A hearty veggie patty with lettuce, tomato, and a house-made vegan mayo. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Sweet Potato Fries: Thinly sliced sweet potatoes fried until crispy. 
3.2) Coleslaw: A refreshing slaw made with shredded cabbage, carrots, and a tangy dressing. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Chip Cookie: A classic cookie with chunks of chocolate. 
4.2) Brownie Sundae: A rich brownie topped with vanilla ice cream, chocolate sauce, and whipped cream. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Milkshake: A thick, creamy milkshake in your choice of flavor. 
5.2) Root Beer Float: A float made with root beer and vanilla ice cream.

 Menu Week 10 (March 5th - March 11th): 
This week, we explore the flavors of Mexico, with a focus on tacos and salsas. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Guacamole: A creamy dip made with mashed avocados, lime juice, and diced tomatoes. 
1.2) Tostadas: Tortillas topped with refried beans, shredded chicken, and salsa. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Carnitas Tacos: Slow-cooked pork tacos with a sweet and tangy sauce. 
2.2) Fish Tacos: Fresh fish tacos with a spicy slaw and a chipotle mayo.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Memorial Day BBQ' on 09-03 with a special dish: Smoked Brisket.
1.3 Celebrate 'Mother's Day Meal' on 05-13 with a special dish: Eggs Benedict with Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.5 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 03-21 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Pasta Wednesdays' every 5 weeks starting from Week 18, serving: Spaghetti Carbonara.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week, we explore the flavors of the Mediterranean with a focus on fresh, vibrant ingredients. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Octopus: Tentacles marinated in olive oil, lemon, and herbs, then grilled to perfection. 
1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, basil, and balsamic glaze. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Lamb Chops: Seasoned with rosemary and garlic, served with a mint yogurt sauce. 
2.2) Sea Bass with Lemon Butter: Flaky sea bass fillets poached in a light lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Crisp Brussels sprouts tossed with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 
3.2) Quinoa Pilaf: A fragrant pilaf made with quinoa, sautéed onions, and fresh herbs. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: Layers of phyllo dough filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup. 
4.2) Greek Yogurt with Honey and Raisins: A refreshing dessert with a touch of sweetness. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Rosé Wine: A crisp, dry rosé to pair with the Mediterranean flavors. 
5.2) Ouzo: Anise-flavored spirit to enhance the aromatic notes.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
Our menu this week is inspired by the rich culinary traditions of Asia, offering a blend of bold and subtle flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Rolls: Crispy rice paper rolls filled with shredded vegetables and shrimp, served with a peanut dipping sauce. 
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with salt and served as a crunchy snack. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Sichuan Beef: Thinly sliced beef stir-fried with Sichuan peppercorns and chili oil. 
2.2) Thai Green Curry Chicken: Chicken pieces simmered in a coconut milk-based curry with green chilies and basil. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Bok Choy: Fresh bok choy steamed and drizzled with sesame oil. 
3.2) Jasmine Rice: Fragrant jasmine rice cooked to perfection. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mango Sticky Rice: Sweet sticky rice served with fresh mango slices and coconut milk. 
4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream: A light and refreshing ice cream made with green tea. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Chinese Herbal Tea: A selection of herbal teas to cleanse the palate. 
5.2) Thai Iced Tea: A sweet and spicy tea to complement the spicy dishes.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week, we delve into the heart of American cuisine, focusing on hearty and comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Fried Green Tomatoes: Thick-cut green tomatoes breaded and fried to a golden crisp. 
1.2) Deviled Eggs: Hard-boiled eggs filled with a creamy mixture of mayonnaise, mustard, and spices. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Southern Fried Chicken: Juicy chicken pieces coated in a buttermilk batter and fried until crispy. 
2.2) Black Bean and Corn Chowder: A hearty soup made with black beans, corn, and a hint of chipotle. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Collard Greens: Slow-cooked collard greens seasoned with bacon and vinegar. 
3.2) Cornbread: A fluffy cornbread served warm with butter. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Pecan Pie: A classic pie with a rich, nutty filling. 
4.2) Apple Crisp: A warm, comforting dessert with a crumbly topping. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Sweet Tea: A refreshing sweet tea to cool down the palate. 
5.2) Bourbon Old Fashioned: A classic cocktail to pair with the savory dishes.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
We celebrate the start of seafood season with a variety of fresh and flavorful options. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Shrimp Cocktail: Large shrimp served in a tangy cocktail sauce. 
1.2) Oysters Rockefeller: Oysters topped with spinach, herbs, and a pungent butter sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection and served with a dill sauce. 
2.2) Lobster Bisque: A creamy bisque made with chunks of lobster and a hint of sherry. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted with olive oil and garlic. 
3.2) Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes with a touch of truffle oil. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Key Lime Pie: A tart and sweet pie with a graham cracker crust. 
4.2) Coconut Sorbet: A refreshing sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine: A crisp white wine to complement the seafood flavors. 
5.2) Raspberry Fizz: A light and fruity cocktail to finish the meal.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
This week, we explore the flavors of the Caribbean, with a focus on tropical fruits and spices. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Jerk Chicken Wings: Chicken wings marinated in jerk seasoning and grilled to perfection. 
1.2) Plantain Chips: Thinly sliced plantains fried until crispy. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Jamaican Jerk Pork: Slow-roasted pork seasoned with jerk spices and served with a pineapple salsa. 
2.2) Coconut Shrimp: Shrimp battered and fried, then tossed in a sweet and sour coconut sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Rice and Peas: A flavorful dish made with rice, peas, and coconut milk. 
3.2) Fried Plantains: Sweet and crispy fried plantains. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Rum Cake: A moist cake soaked in rum and topped with a caramel glaze. 
4.2) Pineapple Upside-Down Cake: A classic dessert with a gooey caramel center. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Rum Punch: A refreshing punch made with various types of rum. 
5.2) Mango Mojito: A light and fruity cocktail to complement the tropical flavors.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
Our menu this week is inspired by the vibrant flavors of India, with a focus on aromatic spices and bold flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Samosas: Crispy pastry cases filled with spiced potatoes and peas, deep-fried to perfection. 
1.2) Papadum: Crispy lentil wafers served with a tamarind chutney. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: Marinated chicken pieces cooked in a creamy tomato-based sauce. 
2.2) Lamb Rogan Josh: Slow-cooked lamb in a rich, aromatic sauce with cardamom and cinnamon. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Basmati Rice: Long-grain rice cooked with a hint of saffron. 
3.2) Naan Bread: Soft and pillowy flatbreads brushed with ghee. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Gulab Jamun: Deep-fried milk balls soaked in sugar syrup. 
4.2) Kulfi: A traditional Indian ice cream made with condensed milk and flavored with cardamom. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Masala Chai: A spiced tea to warm the soul. 
5.2) Mango Lassi: A smooth and creamy yogurt drink with a touch of sweetness.

 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th): 
This week, we explore the flavors of the Middle East, with a focus on中东美食。 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Falafel: 炸至金黄的鹰嘴豆球，搭配新鲜蔬菜和酸奶酱。 
1.2) Hummus: 用鹰嘴豆、橄榄油、柠檬汁和大蒜制成的传统鹰嘴豆泥。 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Kebabs: 烤羊肉串或鸡肉串，搭配香料和蔬菜。 
2.2) Shawarma: 薄饼包裹烤制的鸡肉或羊肉，搭配沙拉和酸奶酱。 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Tabouli: 用新鲜的番茄、黄瓜、洋葱和薄荷制成的凉拌菜。 
3.2) Fattoush: 用新鲜蔬菜、面包丁和芝麻酱制成的沙拉。 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: 层层酥皮夹着碎坚果，淋上糖浆。 
4.2) Halva: 用芝麻、糖和香草制成的传统甜点。 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Arabic Coffee: 传统阿拉伯咖啡，带有浓郁的香气。 
5.2) Turkish Tea: 一种清爽的红茶，适合搭配中东美食。

 Menu Week 9 (February 26th - March 4th): 
我们的菜单本周受到法国烹饪的影响，强调精致和优雅的味道。 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Escargots: 用大蒜和黄油烹制的蜗牛，搭配迷迭香。 
1.2) Ratatouille: 用茄子、西红柿、青椒和洋葱制成的传统法式炖菜。 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Coq au Vin: 用红酒炖制的鸡块，搭配蘑菇和培根。 
2.2) Beef Bourguignon: 用红酒炖制的牛肉，搭配胡萝卜和洋葱。 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Creamed Spinach: 用奶油和奶酪烹制的菠菜。 
3.2) Roasted Potatoes: 用橄榄油和迷迭香烤制的土豆。 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Crème Brûlée: 用奶油和蛋黄制成的经典甜点，表面覆盖一层焦糖。 
4.2) Tarte Tatin: 一种倒置的苹果塔，顶部覆盖一层焦糖。 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine: 一款精选的红葡萄酒，与肉类菜肴完美搭配。 
5.2) Champagne: 一款气泡酒，为这顿饭增添一份庆祝气氛。

 Menu Week 10 (March 5th - March 11th): 
本周，我们探索了意大利的美食，强调简单而美味的味道。 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Bruschetta: 用番茄、罗勒和大蒜制成的传统开胃菜，搭配烤面包片。 
1.2) Arancini: 用米饭、肉末和马苏里拉奶酪制成的炸球。 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Osso Buco: 用红酒炖制的鹿肉，搭配蔬菜和香草。 
2.2) Risotto alla Milanese: 用牛奶和帕尔马干酪制成的经典米兰烩饭。 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Asparagus: 用橄榄油和大蒜烤制的芦笋。 
3.2) Polenta: 用玉米面制成的传统意大利面食。 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Tiramisu: 用咖啡浸泡的手指饼干和马斯卡彭奶酪制成的经典甜点。 
4.2) Gelato: 用各种水果和香草制成的冰淇淋。 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Prosecco: 一款清爽的起泡酒，与意大利美食完美搭配。 
5.2) Espresso: 一杯浓缩咖啡，为这顿饭画上完美的句号。

 Menu Week 11 (March 12th - March 18th): 
本周，我们探索了日本的美食，强调新鲜和精致的味道。 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Sashimi: 新鲜的生鱼片，搭配酱油和芥末。 
1.2) Tempura: 用面粉和水制成的轻炸蔬菜和海鲜。 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Teriyaki Chicken: 用照烧酱腌制的鸡肉，搭配蔬菜和米饭。 
2.2) Udon Noodles: 用日式面条汤底制成的宽面条。 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Pickled Radish: 用盐和醋腌制的萝卜。 
3.2) Wasabi: 一种辛辣的绿色调味品，用于增加风味。 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Green Tea Ice Cream: 用抹茶粉制成的冰淇淋。 
4.2) Japanese Cheesecake: 用奶油奶酪和抹茶制成的经典甜点。 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Green Tea: 一种清爽的绿茶，与日本美食完美搭配。 
5.2) Sake: 一种日本米酒，为这顿饭增添一份庆祝气氛。

 Menu Week 12 (March 19th - March 25th): 
本周，我们探索了墨西哥的美食，强调辣味和丰富的味道。 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Guacamole: 用熟透的鳄梨、番茄、洋葱和辣椒制成的传统开胃菜。 
1.2) Quesadillas: 用玉米饼包裹的奶酪和肉类，煎至金黄色。 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Carnitas: 用慢炖猪肉制成的传统墨西哥菜肴，搭配玉米饼和酸黄瓜。 
2.2) Enchiladas Su RRiogadas: 用辣椒酱和奶酪包裹的卷饼，烤至金黄色。 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Refried Beans: 用煮熟的黑豆制成的传统墨西哥菜肴，搭配辣椒和香菜。 
3.2) Salsa Verde: 用辣椒、番茄和香料制成的传统绿色莎莎酱。 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Churros: 用糖浆蘸过的的油炸长条形甜点，搭配巧克力酱。 
4.2) Flan: 用蛋奶液和香草制成的经典甜点。 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Margarita: 一种经典的龙舌兰鸡尾酒，为这顿饭增添一份庆祝气氛。 
5.2) Horchataa: 一种用龙舌兰花制成的传统墨西哥饮料，为这顿饭增添一份清新感。

 Menu Week 13 (March 26th - April 1st): 
本周，我们探索了印度尼西亚的美食，强调丰富的香料和独特的味道。 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Gado-Gado: 用豆腐、煮熟的蔬菜和花生酱制成的传统印尼凉拌菜。 
1.2) RRujak Cingur 用辣椒、番茄和椰子制成的传统印尼莎莎酱，搭配煮熟的蔬菜。 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) RRendang 用椰奶和香料炖制的牛肉，搭配米饭和蔬菜。 
2.2) Satay 用香料腌制的鸡肉或牛肉串，搭配花生酱和辣椒酱。 
3. Side Dishes:

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.
1.2 Celebrate 'Labor Day BBQ' on 05-01 with a special dish: Grilled Steak.
1.3 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-20 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 11-30 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 2 to Week 5 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Taco Tuesdays' every 3 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Assorted Tacos.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week, we honor the beauty of cherry blossoms with delicate and light dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Sakura Flower Salad: A vibrant salad featuring edible cherry blossoms, mixed greens, and a light vinaigrette. 
1.2) Matcha Green Tea Ice Cream: A refreshing ice cream made with matcha green tea and served with a drizzle of honey. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Sashimi Platter: Freshly sliced raw fish, including salmon, tuna, and yellowtail, served with wasabi and soy sauce. 
2.2) Tempura Vegetables: Lightly battered and fried vegetables, served with a dipping sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Edamame: Steamed edamame seasoned with sea salt. 
3.2) Pickled Daikon Radish: Crisp pickled radish slices, adding a tangy note to the meal. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Sakura Cheesecake: A creamy cheesecake infused with sakura flavor, topped with a cherry blossom garnish. 
4.2) Green Tea Pudding: A smooth and creamy pudding made with green tea and served chilled. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Japanese Sake: A selection of premium sake to pair with the delicate flavors. 
5.2) Green Tea Infused Sparkling Water: A refreshing drink to cleanse the palate.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
Continuing our celebration of cherry blossoms, we offer a variety of sweet and savory treats. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Sakura Blossom Bites: Miniature pastries filled with a sweet bean paste and dusted with powdered sugar. 
1.2) Matcha Shortbread Cookies: Crispy shortbread cookies infused with matcha green tea. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Salmon with Wasabi Butter: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection and served with a spicy wasabi butter sauce. 
2.2) Chicken Teriyaki: Marinated chicken breast grilled and served with a sweet teriyaki glaze. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fluffy and aromatic steamed rice. 
3.2) Pickled Vegetables: A mix of pickled cucumbers, carrots, and daikon radish, providing a crisp texture. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Sakura Mochi: Soft rice cakes filled with sweet red bean paste and wrapped in a thin layer of mochi. 
4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream: A creamy ice cream made with green tea and served with a sprinkle of matcha powder. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Japanese Green Tea: A selection of high-quality green teas to enjoy with your meal. 
5.2) Sparkling Green Tea Soda: A fizzy drink made with green tea and carbonated water.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
Our cherry blossom festival continues with a focus on traditional Japanese sweets and snacks. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Sakura Blossom Tea Cake: A delicate cake infused with sakura flavor and decorated with cherry blossoms. 
1.2) Green Tea Macarons: Light and airy macarons filled with a green tea buttercream. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Yakiniku: Thinly sliced beef grilled at the table, served with a variety of condiments. 
2.2) Vegetable Tempura: Lightly battered and fried vegetables, served with a dipping sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Gyoza: Pan-fried dumplings filled with pork and vegetables. 
3.2) Pickled Radish: Tangy pickled radish slices, adding a zesty element to the meal. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Sakura Cheesecake: A creamy cheesecake infused with sakura flavor, topped with a cherry blossom garnish. 
4.2) Green Tea Parfait: Layers of green tea pudding and green tea sponge cake, finished with a drizzle of green tea syrup. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Japanese Green Tea: A selection of high-quality green teas to enjoy with your meal. 
5.2) Green Tea Infused Sparkling Water: A refreshing drink to cleanse the palate.

The cherry blossom festival concludes with a final array of sweet and savory delights. 
1. Appetizers:

1.2) Green Tea Chiffon Cake: A light and fluffy chiffon cake infused with green tea flavor. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Tofu with Ponzu Sauce: Firm tofu grilled to perfection and served with a zesty ponzu sauce. 
2.2) Chicken Katsu: Breaded and fried chicken cutlet, served with a sweet and sour sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fluffy and aromatic steamed rice. 
3.2) Pickled Vegetables: A mix of pickled cucumbers, carrots, and daikon radish, providing a crisp texture.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
We transition into the heart of winter with hearty and comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Crab Cakes: Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with spices and served as cakes. 
1.2) Truffle Fritters: Lightly fried fritters filled with truffle-infused cream. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Slow-cooked short ribs with a rich, savory sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Scallops: Succulent scallops seared to perfection and served with a lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of roasted root vegetables, including carrots, parsnips, and turnips. 
3.2) Creamed Spinach: Spinach sautéed in cream and butter, seasoned with nutmeg. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Fondue: A warm chocolate fondue with a variety of dipping fruits and marshmallows. 
4.2) Apple Crumble: A classic apple crumble with a crunchy topping. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine: A selection of full-bodied red wines to complement the rich flavors. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich and velvety hot chocolate to warm up the evening.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
This week, we explore the flavors of the Pacific Northwest with fresh seafood and local ingredients. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Oyster Rockefeller: Oysters topped with spinach, mushrooms, and a creamy béchamel sauce. 
1.2) Smoked Salmon Tartare: A vibrant tartare made with smoked salmon, capers, and dill. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Dungeness Crab Legs: Large crab legs steamed and served with a lemon butter sauce. 
2.2) Pacific Halibut: Fresh halibut fillets pan-seared and served with a dill sauce.

3.2) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted until tender and seasoned with olive oil and lemon. 
4. Desserts:

4.2) Maple Pecan Pie: A classic pie with a maple pecan filling and a flaky crust. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine: A selection of crisp white wines to pair with the seafood. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing iced tea to balance the flavors of the meal.

1.2) Grilled Octopus: Tender octopus tentacles grilled and served with a spicy harissa sauce. 
2. Main Courses:

1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Vegetable Tart: A tart filled with a medley of seasonal vegetables, including asparagus, peas, and carrots. 
1.2) Herb and Goat Cheese Crostini: Toasted baguette slices topped with a creamy goat cheese spread and fresh herbs. 
2. Main Courses:

5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing sparkling water to cleanse the palate.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-14 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.

1.4 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.5 Celebrate 'Spring Equinox Celebration' on 01-19 with a special dish: Wild Garlic Pesto Pasta.
2) Feature 'Mushroom Season Specials' from Week 10 to Week 13 with dishes like: Various Mushroom Dishes.

We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)

- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week’s menu focuses on fresh seafood and light, refreshing flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Seared Scallops with Avocado Puree: Succulent scallops seared to perfection, served with a creamy avocado puree. 
1.2) Grilled Octopus Salad: Tender grilled octopus tossed with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and a lemon vinaigrette. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pan-Seared Cod with Lemon Butter Sauce: Flaky cod fillets pan-seared and served with a rich lemon butter sauce. 
2.2) Grilled Salmon with Asparagus: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection, served with a side of asparagus drizzled with olive oil and herbs. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Quinoa Pilaf: A flavorful quinoa pilaf with sautéed onions, carrots, and peas. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy and seasoned with garlic and thyme. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Sorbet: A refreshing lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
4.2) Raspberry Tart: A light and flaky tart filled with fresh raspberries and a hint of almond. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine: A crisp and refreshing white wine to pair with the seafood. 
5.2) Sparkling Water: A choice of sparkling water with a slice of lemon or cucumber.

3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Mashed Turnips: Creamy mashed turnips seasoned with butter and thyme. 
3.2) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.

5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine: A robust red wine to complement the rich flavors. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A steaming mug of hot chocolate to warm up the evening.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week’s menu features international flavors and exotic ingredients.

3. Side Dishes:

3.2) Pickled Vegetables: A variety of pickled vegetables to add a tangy crunch.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Independence Day Celebration' on 07-04 with a special dish: American Apple Pie.
1.2 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 02-07 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Oktoberfest Beer Dinner' on 10-06 with a special dish: Sausages and Sauerkraut.
1.5 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 7 to Week 9 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week, we focus on hearty and comforting dishes to warm up the winter chill. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare: Fresh salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
1.2) Grilled Asparagus with Lemon Butter: Asparagus spears grilled to perfection and drizzled with a zesty lemon butter. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef in red wine with onions, carrots, and mushrooms. 
2.2) Chicken Marsala: Chicken breasts sautéed in Marsala wine with garlic and shallots. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy and seasoned with thyme. 
3.2) Creamed Spinach: Spinach sautéed with garlic and cream, finished with a sprinkle of Parmesan. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Crème Brûlée: Rich custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust. 
4.2) Panna Cotta: Silky vanilla panna cotta with a berry compote. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A variety of red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A decadent hot chocolate to warm up the evening.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
Our menu this week is inspired by the flavors of the Mediterranean. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Greek Feta Cheese Plate: Assorted olives, cherry tomatoes, and fresh herbs served with crumbled feta. 
1.2) Hummus with Pita Chips: Smooth hummus served with crispy pita chips. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Lamb Chops: Tender lamb chops marinated in olive oil and herbs, grilled to perfection. 
2.2) Seafood Paella: A vibrant paella packed with shrimp, mussels, and chorizo, cooked in saffron-infused rice. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Eggplant: Eggplant slices roasted until tender and drizzled with balsamic glaze. 
3.2) Grilled Artichokes: Artichokes grilled until charred and served with a garlic aioli. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: Layers of phyllo dough filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup. 
4.2) Greek Yogurt with Honey and Walnuts: A refreshing yogurt topped with honey and toasted walnuts. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A range of white wines to complement the seafood and lamb. 
5.2) Ouzo: Anise-flavored aperitif to start the meal.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week, we explore the rich flavors of Asian cuisine. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Rolls: Crispy spring rolls filled with shredded vegetables and shrimp, served with a sweet chili dipping sauce. 
1.2) Edamame: Steamed edamame sprinkled with sea salt. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Kung Pao Chicken: Chicken stir-fried with peanuts, dried chili peppers, and scallions. 
2.2) Sushi Platter: A selection of sushi rolls, sashimi, and nigiri. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Bok Choy: Bok choy steamed until tender and seasoned with soy sauce and sesame oil. 
3.2) Rice Noodles: Al dente rice noodles tossed with a savory sauce and vegetables. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mango Sticky Rice: Sweet sticky rice served with fresh mango and coconut milk. 
4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream: A light and refreshing green tea ice cream. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Rice Wine Selection: A variety of rice wines to pair with the Asian-inspired dishes. 
5.2) Green Tea: A soothing green tea to cleanse the palate.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
Our menu this week is all about fresh and light flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil skewered and grilled. 
1.2) Avocado Deviled Eggs: Deviled eggs filled with a creamy avocado mixture. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Salmon with Lemon Butter: Salmon fillets grilled to perfection and served with a zesty lemon butter. 
2.2) Chicken Satay: Marinated chicken skewers grilled over charcoal and served with peanut sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Grilled Zucchini: Zucchini slices grilled until tender and seasoned with garlic and herbs. 
3.2) Quinoa Salad: A refreshing quinoa salad with cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, and feta cheese. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Sorbet: A light and refreshing lemon sorbet. 
4.2) Raspberry Sorbet: A sweet and tangy raspberry sorbet. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A range of white wines to complement the lighter main courses. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A selection of iced teas to refresh the palate.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
This week, we celebrate the arrival of spring with fresh and vibrant flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Vegetable Tart: A tart filled with a mix of seasonal vegetables and herbs. 
1.2) Grilled Asparagus with Lemon Vinaigrette: Asparagus spears grilled to perfection and drizzled with a lemon vinaigrette. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb: Lamb chops coated in a herbed crust and roasted to perfection. 
2.2) Grilled Halibut with Lemon Butter: Halibut fillets grilled to perfection and served with a zesty lemon butter. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of roasted root vegetables seasoned with rosemary and thyme. 
3.2) Grilled Corn on the Cob: Corn on the cob grilled until tender and seasoned with butter and chili flakes. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Strawberry Shortcake: A classic strawberry shortcake with whipped cream. 
4.2) Lemon Bars: A tart and tangy lemon bar with a buttery crust. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Rosé Selection: A range of rosé wines to complement the spring flavors. 
5.2) Sparkling Water: A selection of sparkling waters to cleanse the palate.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
This week, we celebrate the beauty of cherry blossoms with delicate and sweet dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets: A selection of Japanese sweets and a cup of cherry blossom green tea. 
1.2) Sakura Mochi: Soft rice cakes filled with sweet bean paste and wrapped in cherry blossom leaves. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Sashimi Platter: A selection of fresh sashimi including tuna, salmon, and yellowtail. 
2.2) Tempura: Lightly battered and fried vegetables and seafood. 
3. Side Dishes:
