As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-27 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 01-23 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Thanksgiving Dinner' on 11-22 with a special dish: Roast Turkey with Stuffing.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 9 to Week 10 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Dessert Sundays' every 3 weeks starting from Week 7, serving: Chocolate Lava Cake.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week’s menu is a blend of traditional and modern flavors, perfect for a cozy evening. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare: Fresh salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
1.2) Artichoke Hearts: Marinated artichoke hearts served with a drizzle of olive oil and balsamic reduction. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Wellington: Thinly sliced beef fillet wrapped in puff pastry, baked to golden perfection. 
2.2) Grilled Chicken Breast with Lemon Herb Butter: Juicy chicken breast grilled to perfection, served with a zesty lemon herb butter. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy, tossed with garlic and thyme. 
3.2) Creamed Spinach: Spinach sautéed with garlic and cream, seasoned with nutmeg. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Raspberry Sorbet: Refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
4.2) Panna Cotta: Silky vanilla panna cotta with a hint of almond. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A range of red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Sparkling Water: For those who prefer a non-alcoholic option.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
A week dedicated to fresh and vibrant flavors, ideal for a winter evening. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Caprese Salad Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil skewered and grilled. 
1.2) Grilled Asparagus with Lemon Vinaigrette: Asparagus spears grilled to perfection, drizzled with a tangy lemon vinaigrette. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pan-Seared Cod with Lemon Butter Sauce: Flaky cod fillets pan-seared and served with a light lemon butter sauce. 
2.2) Mushroom Risotto: Arborio rice cooked with a variety of mushrooms, finished with Parmesan cheese. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender, seasoned with rosemary and thyme. 
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Green beans sautéed with almonds and a touch of butter. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Poached Pears: Pears poached in a sweet and spiced syrup. 
4.2) Crème Brûlée: Rich custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A selection of crisp white wines to complement the lighter dishes. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm and comforting hot chocolate to end the meal.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week’s menu features bold and robust flavors, perfect for a cold winter night. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Truffle Mac & Cheese: Macaroni and cheese infused with truffle oil and grated truffle. 
1.2) Grilled Octopus: Tentacles marinated in olive oil and grilled to perfection, served with a side of lemon and parsley. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Osso Buco: Braised veal shanks with a rich, flavorful sauce. 
2.2) Grilled Lamb Chops: Tender lamb chops marinated in herbs and grilled to medium-rare. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Polenta: Creamy polenta served with a drizzle of truffle oil. 
3.2) Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted until crispy, seasoned with rosemary and garlic. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Fondue: Warm chocolate fondue with a variety of dipping fruits and marshmallows. 
4.2) Apple Pie: Classic apple pie with a flaky crust and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A selection of full-bodied red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Hot Spiced Wine: A warming spiced wine to enjoy during the colder evenings.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
A week of elegant and sophisticated flavors, perfect for a special occasion. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Foie Gras Terrine: Smooth foie gras terrine served with a fig jam and toasted brioche. 
1.2) Shrimp Cocktail: Large shrimp served in a tangy cocktail sauce, garnished with celery sticks and lemon wedges. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Rack of Lamb: Tender lamb rack braised with red wine and herbs, served with a mint jelly. 
2.2) Grilled Salmon with Dill Sauce: Flaky salmon fillets grilled to perfection, served with a creamy dill sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted until tender, seasoned with lemon and parmesan. 
3.2) Wild Rice Pilaf: A mix of wild rice, mushrooms, and onions, seasoned with thyme and bay leaves. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Truffle Cake: A rich chocolate cake with a truffle ganache filling. 
4.2) Lemon Tart: A light and refreshing lemon tart with a shortcrust pastry base. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of fine red and white wines to complement the flavors of the meal. 
5.2) Sparkling Cider: A refreshing sparkling cider to cleanse the palate.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
This week’s menu is a celebration of fresh and seasonal ingredients. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Vegetable Tart: A savory tart filled with a mix of spring vegetables, including asparagus, peas, and carrots. 
1.2) Grilled Shrimp Skewers: Large shrimp skewered and grilled with a mix of bell peppers and onions. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Herb-Crusted Rack of Pork: Pork loin coated in a herbed crust and roasted to perfection.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Mid-Autumn Festival' on 09-24 with a special dish: Mooncakes.
1.2 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.
1.3 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 04-06 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.4 Celebrate 'Labor Day BBQ' on 05-01 with a special dish: Grilled Steak.
1.5 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
2) Feature 'Mushroom Season Specials' from Week 22 to Week 25 with dishes like: Various Mushroom Dishes.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 3, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week’s menu is a blend of traditional and modern flavors, perfect for a winter evening. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare: Fresh salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
1.2) Artichoke Hearts: Marinated artichoke hearts served with a drizzle of olive oil and balsamic reduction. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Wellington: Thinly sliced beef fillet wrapped in puff pastry, baked to golden perfection. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Cod: Flaky cod fillets seared to a crisp, served with a light lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until caramelized, tossed with garlic and thyme. 
3.2) Creamed Spinach: Spinach sautéed in cream and butter, seasoned with nutmeg and pepper. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Raspberry Sorbet: Refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
4.2) Panna Cotta: Silky vanilla panna cotta with a hint of almond, topped with fresh berries. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A range of red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: Rich hot chocolate to warm up the evening.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week, we introduce a soup and salad midweek, perfect for a lighter meal. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Truffle Mac & Cheese: Macaroni and cheese infused with truffle oil and parmesan. 
1.2) Grilled Asparagus: Asparagus spears grilled to perfection, seasoned with lemon zest and olive oil. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb: Lamb chops encrusted with herbs and garlic, roasted to medium-rare. 
2.2) Chicken Marsala: Chicken breasts sautéed in marsala wine, served over a bed of risotto. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted with rosemary and thyme. 
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Green beans sautéed with almonds and a touch of butter. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tart filled with a tangy lemon custard. 
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: Soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A variety of white wines to complement the lighter main courses. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing glass of iced tea to quench your thirst.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week, we explore the flavors of the Mediterranean. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted baguette slices topped with diced tomatoes, basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. 
1.2) Hummus Platter: Assorted hummus served with pita bread and vegetable sticks. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Octopus: Tentacles grilled to perfection, served with a spicy harissa sauce. 
2.2) Greek Gyro: Thinly sliced lamb and pork served on a pita with tzatziki and vegetables. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Grilled Eggplant: Eggplant grilled until tender, seasoned with garlic and oregano. 
3.2) Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: Layers of phyllo dough filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup. 
4.2) Greek Yogurt with Honey and Walnuts: Greek yogurt topped with honey and walnuts. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A selection of red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Ouzo: Anise-flavored aperitif to start the evening.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
This week, we focus on seafood, celebrating the freshness of the catch. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a zesty cocktail sauce. 
1.2) Crab Cakes: Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with spices and served as cakes. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Seafood Paella: A vibrant paella packed with shrimp, mussels, clams, and chorizo. 
2.2) Grilled Swordfish: Swordfish steaks grilled to perfection, served with a lemon-butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mussels: Mussels steamed with garlic and white wine. 
3.2) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted with olive oil and lemon. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Ice Cream: A light and refreshing lemon ice cream. 
4.2) Chocolate Fondue: Warm chocolate fondue with a variety of dipping fruits. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) White Wine Selection: A range of white wines to complement the seafood. 
5.2) Sangria: A fruity sangria to enjoy with friends.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
This week, we offer a mix of comfort and indulgence. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Deviled Eggs: Hard-boiled eggs filled with a creamy mayonnaise mixture. 
1.2) Mini Quiches: Miniature quiches filled with a savory egg and cheese mixture. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef stewed in red wine, served with pearl onions and carrots. 
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting pot pie filled with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky crust. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted with rosemary and thyme. 
3.2) Creamed Spinach: Spinach sautéed in cream and butter, seasoned with nutmeg and pepper. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm apple crisp with a crunchy oat topping. 
4.2) Cheesecake: A rich and creamy cheesecake with a graham cracker crust. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A selection of red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: Rich hot chocolate to warm up the evening.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
This week, we feature a variety of international flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Rolls: Crispy spring rolls filled with vegetables and shrimp. 
1.2) Samosas: Spicy samosas filled with potatoes and peas, served with a yogurt dip. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Thai Green Curry: Chicken or beef in a spicy green curry sauce, served with jasmine rice. 
2.2) Moroccan Tagine: A slow-cooked stew of lamb or chicken with apricots and almonds, served with couscous. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Vegetables: A selection of steamed vegetables, including broccoli, carrots, and green beans. 
3.2) Rice Pilaf: A fragrant rice pilaf with saffron and almonds. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mango Sticky Rice: Sweet sticky rice served with fresh mango and coconut milk. 
4.2) Baklava: Layers of phyllo dough filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine Selection: A selection of red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) Mint Tea: A refreshing cup of mint tea to finish the meal.

This week, we celebrate the flavors of the Pacific Northwest. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Smoked Salmon: Fresh smoked salmon served with cream cheese and capers. 
1.2) Wild Mushroom Risotto: A creamy risotto made with wild mushrooms and Parmesan cheese. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pacific Halibut: Fresh halibut fillets grilled to perfection, served with a lemon butter sauce. 
2.2) Venison Medallions: Thinly sliced venison medallions pan-seared to medium-rare. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted with rosemary and thyme.

5.1) Red Wine Selection A selection of red wines to pair with the hearty main courses.
